snippet.title: Amber Alert: Toddler found safe, half-brother arrested
snippet.description: MILFORD, Ohio (WKRC) -- A young child was found safe after an Amber Alert was issued for her in the Tri-State Monday, May 11. Local 12's Angenette Levy found the 22-month-old, Agnes Burgess, by chance in the neighborhood where the child lives with her family. Angenette knocked on the door of the home were Agnes older, half-brother lives, Donovan Coleman. A dog was barking very loudly and then a child could be heard screaming from inside the home. When nobody answered the door Angenette looked in the window and saw Agnes. She immediately called her mother. Agnes' mother went inside the house and found the child safe. It is suspected Coleman dropped the child off at the home after taking his mothers car from a pawn shop in Milford. "We're just fortunate that she didn't fall or anything like that. All's well that ends well and we still care about Donovan, he still needs to find himself a place 'cause otherwise everything is going to keep escalating." Police said the Coleman stole the car from his mother. The vehicle was found on Seymour Avenue in Carthage. People were found in the car and taken into custody by police. They told officials they had traded drugs for the vehicle. Donovan Coleman was found and is being questioned by Cincinnati police. He will face several charges including child endangering. Follow Angenette Levy on Twitter @angenette5, and LIKE her on Facebook.Follow us on Twitter @Local12 and LIKE us on Facebook for updates! ------------------------------------------------------------- MILFORD, Ohio (WKRC) -- An Amber Alert has been issued for a young man accused of taking off with his mother's car, with his young sister inside. Police are worried because the family says Donovan Coleman, 21, is a heroin user.Police say the 2003 Toyota Matrix was stolen this morning from the parking lot of Facet Music Jewelry and Pawn on Chamber Drive. Coleman's 22-month-old sister, Agnes Burgess, was in the vehicle. Police plan to charge Coleman with felony theft and child endangering.Agness has brown curly hair and blue eyes. She's wearing a multi-color pink tank top, pink shorts and no shoes or socks.The car is missing its front bumper. It has Ohio plates FBU 6986. Anyone who can help police find Donovan Coleman should call 825-2280 or 911. Anyone who can help police find Donovan Coleman should call 825-2280 or 911.
